summary: This document is a chain of emails between FBI agents and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) in October 2020. The correspondence concerns obtaining subscriber and toll information for two UK phone numbers via an MLAT request, specifically seeking evidence of communications between those numbers and other individuals relevant to the investigation in early 2018.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary correspondent from the U.S. Attorney's Office (USANYS) requesting phone record data and subscriber information for two UK numbers to support an MLAT application for the investigation.

persons.name: FBI Agent (NY)
persons.context: The FBI agent responding to the prosecutor's requests, providing dates of first contact for the UK numbers and sending spreadsheets with detailed toll information obtained from subpoena returns and whistleblower interviews.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: Working relationship where the prosecutor requests investigative data (phone records) from the FBI agent to support an MLAT application for the investigation.

keyFacts: The SDNY was actively pursuing an MLAT (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty) request to obtain information on two UK phone numbers (Vodafone UK subscribers) in late 2020.

The FBI had obtained phone toll data via subpoena returns and whistleblower interviews, showing communications between the UK numbers and other individuals relevant to the investigation, with first contacts dating to early 2018.
The investigative focus included establishing a pattern of communication between specific phone numbers and individuals associated with the case to support the MLAT application.
